fr.sii.ogham.testing.assertion

Class OghamAssertions

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sii.ogham.testing.assertion.OghamAssertions

  • public final class OghamAssertions
extends Object
    Utility class that helps writing message assertions. For emails, you can write something like this: 
     
 assertThat(greenMail)
   .receivedMessages()
     .count(is(1))
       .message(0)
         .subject(is("Test"))
         .from()
           .address(hasItems("test.sender@sii.fr"))
           .and()
         .to()
           .address(hasItems("recipient@sii.fr"))
         .and()
       .body()
 		   .contentAsString(is("body"))
         .contentType(startsWith("text/plain"))
         .and()
       .alternative(nullValue())
       .attachments(hasSize(1))
         .attachment("04-Java-OOP-Basics.pdf")
 		     .content(is(resource("/attachment/04-Java-OOP-Basics.pdf")))
           .contentType(startsWith("application/pdf"))
           .filename(is("04-Java-OOP-Basics.pdf"))
           .disposition(is(ATTACHMENT_DISPOSITION));
    For sms, you can write something like this: 
     
 assertThat(smppServer)
   .receivedMessages()
     .count(is(1))
       .message(0)
         .content(is("sms content"))
         .from()
           .number(is(INTERNATIONAL_PHONE_NUMBER))
           .typeOfNumber(is(TypeOfNumber.INTERNATIONAL))
 		     .numberPlanIndicator(is(NumberingPlanIndicator.ISDN))
           .and()
         .to()
           .number(is(NATIONAL_PHONE_NUMBER))
           .typeOfNumber(is(TypeOfNumber.UNKNOWN))
 		     .numberPlanIndicator(is(NumberingPlanIndicator.ISDN));
    Author:
    Aur√©lien Baudet

    • Method Detail

      • assertThat

        public static FluentReceivedEmailsAssert assertThat(com.icegreen.greenmail.junit4.GreenMailRule greenMail)
        Helper method to write assertions on mails using fluent API. For example: 
         
 assertThat(greenMail).receivedMessages()
   .count(is(1))
   .message(0)
     .subject(is("Test"))
     .from().address(hasItems("test.sender@sii.fr")).and()
     .to().address(hasItems("recipient@sii.fr")).and()
   .body()
      .contentAsString(is("body"))
      .contentType(startsWith("text/plain")).and()
   .alternative(nullValue())
   .attachments(hasSize(1))
   .attachment("04-Java-OOP-Basics.pdf")
      .content(is(resource("/attachment/04-Java-OOP-Basics.pdf")))
      .contentType(startsWith("application/pdf"))
      .filename(is("04-Java-OOP-Basics.pdf"))
      .disposition(is(ATTACHMENT_DISPOSITION));
        Parameters:
        greenMail - email server that stores received messages
        Returns:
        builder for fluent assertions on received messages

      • assertThat

        public static FluentReceivedEmailsAssert assertThat(com.icegreen.greenmail.junit4.GreenMailRule greenMail,
                                                    AssertionRegistry registry)
        Helper method to write assertions on mails using fluent API. For example: 
         
 assertAll(registry -> 
   assertThat(greenMail, registry).receivedMessages()
     .count(is(1))
     .message(0)
       .subject(is("Test"))
       .from().address(hasItems("test.sender@sii.fr")).and()
       .to().address(hasItems("recipient@sii.fr")).and()
     .body()
        .contentAsString(is("body"))
        .contentType(startsWith("text/plain")).and()
     .alternative(nullValue())
     .attachments(hasSize(1))
     .attachment("04-Java-OOP-Basics.pdf")
        .content(is(resource("/attachment/04-Java-OOP-Basics.pdf")))
        .contentType(startsWith("application/pdf"))
        .filename(is("04-Java-OOP-Basics.pdf"))
        .disposition(is(ATTACHMENT_DISPOSITION)));

        This method is used in combination of assertAll(Consumer...) in order to report all exceptions/assertion failures at the end instead of stopping at the first failure.

        Parameters:
        greenMail - email server that stores received messages
        registry - the registry used to register assertions
        Returns:
        builder for fluent assertions on received messages

      • assertThat

        public static FluentReceivedEmailsAssert assertThat(com.icegreen.greenmail.junit5.GreenMailExtension greenMail,
                                                    AssertionRegistry registry)
        Helper method to write assertions on mails using fluent API. For example: 
         
 assertAll(registry -> 
   assertThat(greenMail, registry).receivedMessages()
     .count(is(1))
     .message(0)
       .subject(is("Test"))
       .from().address(hasItems("test.sender@sii.fr")).and()
       .to().address(hasItems("recipient@sii.fr")).and()
     .body()
        .contentAsString(is("body"))
        .contentType(startsWith("text/plain")).and()
     .alternative(nullValue())
     .attachments(hasSize(1))
     .attachment("04-Java-OOP-Basics.pdf")
        .content(is(resource("/attachment/04-Java-OOP-Basics.pdf")))
        .contentType(startsWith("application/pdf"))
        .filename(is("04-Java-OOP-Basics.pdf"))
        .disposition(is(ATTACHMENT_DISPOSITION)));

        This method is used in combination of assertAll(Consumer...) in order to report all exceptions/assertion failures at the end instead of stopping at the first failure.

        Parameters:
        greenMail - email server that stores received messages
        registry - the registry used to register assertions
        Returns:
        builder for fluent assertions on received messages

      • assertThat

        public static FluentEmailsAssert<Void> assertThat(javax.mail.internet.MimeMessage[] receivedEmails)
        Helper method to write assertions on mails using fluent API. For example: 
         
 assertThat(greenMail.getReceivedMessages())
   .count(is(1))
   .message(0)
     .subject(is("Test"))
     .from().address(hasItems("test.sender@sii.fr")).and()
     .to().address(hasItems("recipient@sii.fr")).and()
   .body()
      .contentAsString(is("body"))
      .contentType(startsWith("text/plain")).and()
   .alternative(nullValue())
   .attachments(hasSize(1))
   .attachment("04-Java-OOP-Basics.pdf")
      .content(is(resource("/attachment/04-Java-OOP-Basics.pdf")))
      .contentType(startsWith("application/pdf"))
      .filename(is("04-Java-OOP-Basics.pdf"))
      .disposition(is(ATTACHMENT_DISPOSITION));
        Parameters:
        receivedEmails - list of messages received by the email server
        Returns:
        builder for fluent assertions on received messages

      • assertThat

        public static FluentEmailsAssert<Void> assertThat(javax.mail.internet.MimeMessage[] receivedEmails,
                                                  AssertionRegistry registry)
        Helper method to write assertions on mails using fluent API. For example: 
         
 assertAll(registry -> 
   assertThat(greenMail.getReceivedMessages(), registry)
     .count(is(1))
     .message(0)
       .subject(is("Test"))
       .from().address(hasItems("test.sender@sii.fr")).and()
       .to().address(hasItems("recipient@sii.fr")).and()
     .body()
        .contentAsString(is("body"))
        .contentType(startsWith("text/plain")).and()
     .alternative(nullValue())
     .attachments(hasSize(1))
     .attachment("04-Java-OOP-Basics.pdf")
        .content(is(resource("/attachment/04-Java-OOP-Basics.pdf")))
        .contentType(startsWith("application/pdf"))
        .filename(is("04-Java-OOP-Basics.pdf"))
        .disposition(is(ATTACHMENT_DISPOSITION)));

        This method is used in combination of assertAll(Consumer...) in order to report all exceptions/assertion failures at the end instead of stopping at the first failure.

        Parameters:
        receivedEmails - list of messages received by the email server
        registry - the registry used to register assertions
        Returns:
        builder for fluent assertions on received messages

      • assertThat

        public static <M> FluentReceivedSmsAssert<SubmitSm> assertThat(SmppServerRule<M> smsServer)
        Helper method to write assertions on sms using fluent API. For example: 
         
 assertThat(smppServer).receivedMessages()
   .count(is(1))
   .message(0)
     .content(is("sms content"))
     .from()
       .number(is(INTERNATIONAL_PHONE_NUMBER))
       .typeOfNumber(is(TypeOfNumber.INTERNATIONAL))
       .numberPlanIndicator(is(NumberingPlanIndicator.ISDN)).and()
     .to()
       .number(is(NATIONAL_PHONE_NUMBER))
       .typeOfNumber(is(TypeOfNumber.UNKNOWN))
       .numberPlanIndicator(is(NumberingPlanIndicator.ISDN));
        Type Parameters:
        M - the type of messages handled by the server
        Parameters:
        smsServer - SMS server that stores received messages
        Returns:
        builder for fluent assertions on received messages

        public static <M> FluentReceivedSmsAssert<SubmitSm> assertThat(SmppServerRule<M> smsServer,
                                                               AssertionRegistry registry)
        Helper method to write assertions on sms using fluent API. For example: 
         
 assertAll(registry ->
   assertThat(smppServer, registry).receivedMessages()
     .count(is(1))
     .message(0)
       .content(is("sms content"))
       .from()
         .number(is(INTERNATIONAL_PHONE_NUMBER))
         .typeOfNumber(is(TypeOfNumber.INTERNATIONAL))
         .numberPlanIndicator(is(NumberingPlanIndicator.ISDN)).and()
       .to()
         .number(is(NATIONAL_PHONE_NUMBER))
         .typeOfNumber(is(TypeOfNumber.UNKNOWN))
         .numberPlanIndicator(is(NumberingPlanIndicator.ISDN)));

        This method is used in combination of assertAll(Consumer...) in order to report all exceptions/assertion failures at the end instead of stopping at the first failure.

        Type Parameters:
        M - the type of messages handled by the server
        Parameters:
        smsServer - SMS server that stores received messages

        public static FluentSmsListAssert<Void,SubmitSm> assertThat(List<SubmitSm> receivedSms,

      • assertAll

        @SafeVarargs
public static void assertAll(Consumer<AssertionRegistry>... executables)
        Register all assertions in order to report all failures/failed assertions at once instead of reporting error one by one. 
         
 assertAll(registry -> 
   assertThat(smppServer.getReceivedMessages(), registry)
     .count(is(1))
     .message(0)
       .content(is("sms content"))
       .from()
         .number(is(INTERNATIONAL_PHONE_NUMBER))
         .typeOfNumber(is(TypeOfNumber.INTERNATIONAL))
         .numberPlanIndicator(is(NumberingPlanIndicator.ISDN)).and()
       .to()
         .number(is(NATIONAL_PHONE_NUMBER))
         .typeOfNumber(is(TypeOfNumber.UNKNOWN))
         .numberPlanIndicator(is(NumberingPlanIndicator.ISDN)));
        Parameters:
        executables - the list of functions to register
